title: Work permit
description: We assist with Canadian work permits, whether open, employer-specific, or LMIA-based, guiding workers and employers through a smooth, compliant process.

title: Study permit
description: Planning to study in Canada? We help students secure their study permits by preparing strong applications, helping with letters of acceptance, and ensuring compliance with post-secondary and immigration regulations.

title: Express entry
description: We manage complete Express Entry profiles for skilled workers under the Federal Skilled Worker, Canadian Experience Class, and Federal Skilled Trades programs. Our services include profile creation, document review, and ITA (Invitation to Apply) submissions.

title: Caregiver program
description: With expertise in caregiver placements, we offer full support for the Home Child Care Provider and Home Support Worker pilots. We assist with eligibility assessment, LMIA (if applicable), work permits, and eventual permanent residence pathways.

title: Family sponsorship
description: Reunite with your loved ones through Canada’s family sponsorship programs. We handle the entire process—whether you’re sponsoring parents, children, or other eligible relatives—ensuring all requirements are met and documents are correctly submitted.

title: Spousal sponsorship
description: We help Canadian citizens and permanent residents sponsor their spouses or common-law partners—whether inland or overseas. Our process ensures complete and strong applications with detailed relationship documentation to avoid delays or refusals.

title: Provincial nominee program (PNP)
description: We assist applicants in applying to PNP streams across different provinces, whether through Express Entry-aligned or base streams. We help identify the right province, prepare complete applications, and support post-nomination PR submissions.

title: Canadian citizenship
description: Ready to become a Canadian citizen? We guide you through the eligibility assessment, document preparation, and application process—ensuring you’re set for your next chapter in Canada.

title: Super visa
description: The Super Visa allows parents and grandparents to visit Canada for extended periods. We prepare applications that meet income, insurance, and relationship requirements—so your family can stay longer and visit more often.

title: Temporary resident permit (TRP)
description: If you’re inadmissible to Canada but have a valid reason to enter, we can help you apply for a TRP. We assess your circumstances and prepare compelling submissions for temporary entry approval.

title: Labour market impact assessment (LMIA)
description: We assist Canadian employers in obtaining positive LMIAs to hire foreign workers. Our services cover recruitment requirements, application preparation, and representation throughout the process.

title: GCMS notes and immigration consultation
description: We request and review GCMS/CAIPS notes to help you understand refusals or application progress. We also offer personalized immigration consultations to assess your options and guide your next steps.
